meanings.definition: To make a smooth transition from one topic or section to another.
meanings.sent1: She did a great job segueing from talking about her favorite book to discussing her favorite movie.
meanings.sent2: He always seamlessly segueing from one song to the next during his DJ sets.
meanings.sent3: The magician was so good at segueing between tricks that the audience couldn't tell where one ended and the next began.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed gently, segueing from a narrow stream to a wide expanse as it meandered through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a clever segueing technique to shift the class's focus from math to science in a way that kept everyone engaged.

meanings.definition: The act of smoothly transitioning from one topic or section to another.
meanings.sent1: Her segueing between different subjects in her presentation was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The segueing between scenes in the play was so well done that the audience was captivated.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's segueing from one joke to the next had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting depicted a beautiful segueing of colors from light to dark, creating a stunning contrast.
meanings.sent5: The seamless segueing between chapters in the book made it a joy to read.
